Miles Sound System SDK 6.6h

AIL_set_3D_sample_file

The function AIL_set_3D_sample_file sets the sample starting address, type, and playback rate from the input file image.

S32 AIL_set_3D_sample_file(
  H3DSAMPLE S,
  void const * file_image
);

In Parameters

S
indicates the sample handle whose address and length are to be set.
file_image
points to an uncompressed WAV file image.

Returns

Non-zero if the file is successfully loaded, zero if the image could not be deciphered or hardware resources were unavailable.

Discussion

The input file image must be a Microsoft mono, uncompressed PCM WAV file.

Note that this function call resets all of the sound attributes (volume, position, orientation, etc).

This function only takes uncompressed WAV files, so you must use AIL_decompress_ADPCM or AIL_decompress_ASI to decompress the data before calling this function. This function also only takes mono data, so you must use AIL_process_digital_audio to convert stereo files, if necessary. Except, however, on Xbox, where all Miles supported compressed formats are supported.

Example files that use this function: EXAM3D.C
